html: Isaiah likens Jehovah’s people going to their death to Sheol (se’ol)—the “underworld,” “Hell,” or “spirit prison”—devouring them like a gluttonous woman. The word mouth additionally serves as a pseudonym of the archtyrant. Daniel and John depict him as “a mouth speaking great things” (Daniel 7:8, 20; Revelation 13:5; emphasis added). Isaiah portrays him as a beast “bellowing” and “snorting” against Jehovah (Isaiah 37:29): “Whom have you mocked and ridiculed? Against whom have you raised your voice, lifting your eyes to high heaven? Against the Holy One of Israel!” (Isaiah 37:23).
